data.title: Who Is The Most Famous Howard In The World?
data.meta_description: The Who Is The Most Famous Howard In The World?, as voted on by fans. Current Top 3: Bryce Dallas Howard, Clint Howard, Moe Howard
data.text:
Voting Rules

Vote up everyone you recognize with the last name Howard.

How many celebrities with the last name Howard can you think of? The famous Howards below have many different professions, including notable actors with the last name Howard, famous musicians named Howard, and even athletes named Howard.

Ron Howard is certainly one of the most famous Howards on this list. One of the famous actors and directors with the last name Howard, he started his career playing Opie Taylor in The Andy Griffith Show. He went on to direct such films as Frost/Nixon and A Beautiful Mind, the latter of which earned him an Oscar for Best Director and Best Picture.

Another of the famous people with the last name Howard is Terrence Howard. He is the actor who portrays Lucious Lyon in Empire. Hustle & Flow, Prisoners, and Crash are among his film credits.

Did we forget one of your favorite famous people with the last name Howard? Just add them to the list. Then be sure to vote up every celebrity with the surname Howard that you've heard of! After that, you can look at our list of celebrities with the first name Howard.

Birthplace : Los Angeles, USA, California

Bryce Dallas Howard, an American actress and director, has become an indelible figure in the world of entertainment with her versatile performances and innovative storytelling. Born on March 2, 1981, in Los Angeles, California, she was raised in a family steeped in showbiz. As the eldest daughter of renowned director Ron Howard, Bryce's exposure to film and television began at an early age, fostering a passion for performing that would shape her future career. Howard's professional acting career took flight after graduating from New York University's Tisch School of the Arts. Her breakthrough role came in 2004, starring in M. Night Shyamalan's thriller The Village. The film catapulted her into the spotlight and led to prominent roles in several other notable films such as Lady in the Water, Spider-Man 3, and the blockbuster Jurassic World series. Howard's performances are often characterized by their intensity and emotional depth, demonstrating her ability to bring complex characters to life on screen. In addition to her impressive acting career, Howard has also made her mark behind the camera. She directed the critically acclaimed documentary Dads which explores modern fatherhood through a blend of interviews and home footage. Moreover, she ventured into directing television episodes, most notably for the series The Mandalorian. A true multi-hyphenate talent, Bryce Dallas Howard continues to captivate audiences with her dynamic performances and innovative storytelling, solidifying her position in Hollywood.

Birthplace : Burbank, California, USA

Clint Howard, born in Burbank, California on April 20, 1959, is an acclaimed American character actor with a career spanning over five decades. Born into a family deeply rooted in the entertainment industry, Howard's journey began as a child actor. His father, Rance Howard, was a renowned actor, and his mother, Jean Speegle Howard, was an actress. His older brother, Ron Howard, is a famed director and actor. From this sturdy foundation, Clint Howard developed a strong foothold in Hollywood. Howard's acting career launched when he was just two years old, making his screen debut in the film The Journey. However, it was his role as Leon on the classic TV series The Andy Griffith Show, where his brother Ron played Opie, that truly catapulted his career. Throughout his career, Howard has been featured in over 200 films and television shows, showcasing his versatility across genres from horror to comedy. He is best known for his roles in films like Apollo 13, The Waterboy, and How the Grinch Stole Christmas. Despite being often outshone by his brother's successful directing career, Clint Howard has carved out a unique niche for himself. He has worked extensively with his brother Ron, appearing in many of his films. Howard's contributions to cinema were recognized when he received the Lifetime Achievement Award at the 2017 MTV Movie & TV Awards. Off-screen, Howard is an avid golfer and former competitive card player, having participated in the World Series of Poker.

Birthplace : Brooklyn, New York, USA

Moses Harry Horwitz (June 19, 1897 – May 4, 1975), known professionally as Moe Howard, was an American actor and comedian, best known as the leader of the Three Stooges, the farce comedy team who starred in motion pictures and television for four decades. That group originally started out as Ted Healy and His Stooges, an act that toured the vaudeville circuit. Moe's distinctive hairstyle came about when he was a boy and cut off his curls with a pair of scissors, producing a ragged shape approximating a bowl cut.

Birthplace : Orlando, Florida, USA

Traylor Elizabeth Howard (born June 14, 1966) is an American actress. She is known for playing Sharon Carter on the television series Two Guys and a Girl, and Natalie Teeger on the USA Network series Monk.

Birthplace : London, United Kingdom

Benjamin John "Ben" Howard is an English singer-songwriter. He self-released his debut EP Games in the Dark followed by two more EPs, These Waters and Old Pine. He is currently signed to Island and Communion. His major debut studio album came in 2011 titled Every Kingdom followed by two more EP releases, Ben Howard Live and The Burgh Island E.P.. He performed at 2013 Glastonbury festival on the Pyramid Stage on Saturday 29 June. He released his second studio album, I Forget Where We Were, in October 2014.

Birthplace : El Centro, California, USA

Kenneth Joseph Howard Jr. (March 28, 1944 – March 23, 2016) was an American actor, best known for his roles as Thomas Jefferson in 1776 and as basketball coach and former Chicago Bulls player Ken Reeves in the television show The White Shadow (1978–1981). Howard won the Tony Award for Best Featured Actor in a Play in 1970 for his performance in Child's Play, and later won the Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Miniseries or a Movie for his work in Grey Gardens (2009). Howard was elected president of the actors' union, Screen Actors Guild (SAG), in September 2009 and reelected to a second term, in September 2011. He was the last president of the Screen Actors Guild and the first president of the newly formed union, SAG-AFTRA, after the Screen Actors Guild and another union, the American Federation of Television and Radio Artists (AFTRA), voted to merge in 2012. He was reelected in 2015.
